channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2023100626
item.description:
Report E-2023100626

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: DYERSBURG
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 10, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1199 was crushed during transit and released approximately forty-five (45) gallons of product to the trailer floor and asphalt below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. It was determined that all material released had fully evaporated prior to the crews arrival and was no longer recoverable. The damaged drum was located and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon overpack for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023091097
item.description:
Report X-2023091097

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: 1 quart bottle had a loose cap, resulting in leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: One out of three one-gallon bottles experienced leakage due to a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the load side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: 2 of 2 2.5-gallon bottles had a loose cap, resulting in the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023081329
item.description:
Report X-2023081329

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-26T15:12:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the dangerous goods building for a damaged plastic jerrycan. The spill agent was told that the plastic jerrycan fell off the roller during the loading process. The fall caused a puncture on the bottom of the jerrycan. It was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement. X-2023081330-A Memphis spill agent was called to the dangerous goods building for a damaged plastic jerrycan. The spill agent was told that the plastic jerrycan fell off the roller during the loading process. The fall caused a puncture on the bottom of the jerrycan. It was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023081041
item.description:
Report X-2023081041

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to the heavyweight buildup area for a leaking shipment. The shipment was two metal jerrycans banded to a wooden skid. A forklift punctured one of the jerrycans causing a release of all of its contents. The spill was contained and cleaned up. The damaged jerrycan will be disposed of a hazardous material and the remaining jerrycan is being held till a new declaration can be obtained.

item.title: Report X-2023081035
item.description:
Report X-2023081035

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 8/15/2023 at approximately 1740, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 749919 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of two fiberboard boxes, each containing two cans of paint. One of the boxes displayed damage due to spillage from one the cans. The damaged shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for further transport. X-2023081036-On 8/15/2023 at approximately 1740, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 749919 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a paint spill. The shipment consisted of two fiberboard boxes, each containing two cans of paint. One of the boxes displayed damage due to spillage from one the cans. The damaged shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023080954
item.description:
Report X-2023080954

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 08/05/2023 at approximately 1333, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 245975 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting an aerosol spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing four aluminum cans. Two of the cans were reported as allegedly being over-pressurized, causing one can to accidentally discharge uncontrollably from the nozzle and the other burst, tearing the bottom of the can completely off. Due to the overseas origin and destination, this shipment has been set for disposal.
